name: tips to reduce toxicity in a relationship

speech:
Communicate Openly:

    Share your feelings calmly and listen to your partner without judgment.
    Use "I feel" statements instead of blaming (e.g., "I feel hurt when...").

Understand Each Other’s Needs:

    Ask your partner what they expect or need in the relationship.
    Share your needs honestly, too.

Show Appreciation:

    Express gratitude for the little things your partner does.
    Small acts of kindness can rebuild connection.

Spend Quality Time:

    Prioritize moments together, even if they’re short but meaningful.
    Try something new together, like a hobby or a relaxing activity.

Resolve Conflicts Gently:

    Focus on the issue, not the person. Avoid bringing up past mistakes during arguments.
    Take a break if emotions run high, then revisit the topic calmly.

Set Boundaries:

    Maintain personal space and respect each other’s individuality.
